DataElement.preferredName: ARACNE Algorithm Programming Parameter Mutual Information Value Threshold java.lang.Double
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An information-theoretic algorithm for reverse engineering of transcriptional networks using microarray data, specifically designed to scale up to the complexity of regulatory networks in mammalian cells, yet general enough to address a wider range of network deconvolution problems, while eliminating the majority of indirect interactions inferred by co-expression methods.:A value that is passed to a routine._Expresses the extent to which the observed frequency of co-occurrence differs from that expected under the null hypothesis.:The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant._Generic value domain for a primitive java datatype that is a Double-precision floating point number (64-bit IEEE 7540).

A value that is passed to a routine.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
